item.title: Half Day Whitewater Rafting Trip
item.description: Take to the water for an adrenaline-fuelled white-water rafting excursion in the Glacier National Park. Paddle along the Middle Fork of the Flathead River, enjoy a thrilling 8-mile (13-kilometer) route including Class II and II rapids, and admire stunning views of the John Stevens Canyon and the surrounding Glacier National Park.

image.alt: Half Day Whitewater Rafting Trip

item.title: Half Day Scenic Float on the Middle Fork of the Flathead River
item.description: Take a break from sightseeing and rushing from place to place and spend a few hours floating on the Middle Fork of the Flathead River. This relaxing and rejuventating tour takes place on the boundary to Glacier National Park. Enjoy the scenery as you float and, with luck, spot some wildlife along the way.

image.alt: Half Day Scenic Float on the Middle Fork of the Flathead River

item.title: Half-Day Glacier National Park Whitewater Rafting Adventure
item.description: See Glacier National Park in a way that few people get to with this half-day whitewater rafting tour. You'll get your bearings paddling through a calm stretch of water before making your way to the John Stevens Canyon, where you'll tackle a variety of thrilling rapids. A guide will be with you throughout your adventure and beginners are welcome to join in on the fun.

image.alt: Half-Day Glacier National Park Whitewater Rafting Adventure

item.title: Full Day Whitewater Adventure Trip with Included Lunch
item.description: Immerse yourself in the natural beauty of Montana with this full-day floating and rafting tour from West Glacier. Unwind and take in the views as you float—and challenge yourself on Class II and III rapids—on the Middle Fork of the Flathead River, which borders Glacier National Park. During the day, you'll make a stop to refuel with a barbecue lunch on the riverbank.

image.alt: Full Day Whitewater Adventure Trip with Included Lunch

item.title: Full Day Glacier National Park Whitewater Rafting Adventure - With Lunch!
item.description:
Explore Glacier National Park's Wild and Scenic border river, the Middle Fork Flathead, with our highly trained, friendly, interpretive river guides. First, float a relaxing stretch of river. Next, your guide selects a secluded spot for a delicious, buffet style lunch. Our kitchen sources locally and organically whenever possible, and you’ll taste the difference!
After lunch, explore 9 named rapids - typically rated class II and III. Bonecrusher is always a favorite! This is a fun and splashy adventure through pristine, glacially fed waters. Finally, float beneath Glacier’s historic Old Belton Bridge. Your adventure ends in West Glacier with a 5 minute bus ride back to our campus.
Trips depart rain or shine. Trips meet at 9:15am, 9:45am departure. No experience necessary.
No maximum weight - must be able to buckle a 58" chest life jacket. Minimum age 5, minimum weight of 50 pounds. Minimums may be higher if river levels are higher, as they often are in the spring.

image.alt: Full Day Glacier National Park Whitewater Rafting Adventure - With Lunch!

item.title: Glacier National Park Scenic Float
item.description: This scenic float along the southern border of Glacier National Park offers a restful, rejuvenating experience along the Middle Fork of the Flathead River. With your guide paddling downstream, this is a great option for families, small children, and those with no rafting experience. Make it extra-special by booking dinner—a meal cooked on the river’s edge by your guide.

image.alt: Glacier National Park Scenic Float

item.title: West Glacier & Polebridge Scenic Driving Tour
item.description: See many of the highlights of Glacier National Park without worrying about navigation or logistics—and enjoy a fully personalized sightseeing experience—on this private, half-day driving tour. With round-trip transit from Whitefish, getting there is comfortable and hassle-free. Led by your driver-guide, discover highlights from the Hungry Horse Dam and Lake McDonald to the North Fork River, Polebridge, and beyond, all in just half a day.

image.alt: West Glacier & Polebridge Scenic Driving Tour

item.title: Half Day Whitewater Rafting with Riverside Dinner
item.description: If there’s one surefire way to get away from the crowds in Glacier National Park, it’s getting on the water. And with this whitewater rafting experience, you’re not just guaranteed spectacular views, immersion in nature, and a high-adrenaline time on class II-III rapids—you’ll also get an off-grid barbecue dinner, your reward after an awesome day’s adventure.

image.alt: Half Day Whitewater Rafting with Riverside Dinner

item.title: Self-Guided Audio Driving Tour in Glacier National Park
item.description: Download a self-guided audio guide, tour Glacier National Park, and enrich your road trip with fascinating stories, local tips, and automatic directions based on your location. Explore famous highlights and hidden gems like Three Arches, Many Glaciers, and the park's most photographed tiny island. Enjoy the freedom to travel at your own pace, offline, and without Wi-Fi. With suggested itineraries for various trip lengths and no time limits, it's like having a personal tour guide in your car.

image.alt: Self-Guided Audio Driving Tour in Glacier National Park

item.title: East Glacier & Two Medicine Scenic Driving Tour
item.description: Leave behind worrying about Glacier National Park’s confusing reservation system and book a guided scenic driving tour that takes care of it all. You’ll explore the park’s popular East Glacier and Two Medicine areas, witnessing spectacular spots like East Glacier Park Lodge and Two Medicine Lake. Your guide provides valuable insight along the way, ensuring you get the most out of your time in “The Crown of the Continent.”

image.alt: East Glacier & Two Medicine Scenic Driving Tour

item.title: Nature Walk in Glacier National Park
item.description:
Meet at Glacier Guides & Montana Raft at 9:30am to meet your guide and go over a brief orientation. Once in Glacier, you'll get to explore Glacier's natural wonders on a guided adventure! Start with a 1-mile round trip walk through Lake McDonald Valley, admiring its glaciated beauty and resident wildlife. Then, venture to the North Fork Valley with scenic stops en route. Take another 1-mile round trip walk along the Wild and Scenic North Fork of the Flathead River, learning about the environment and its history.
This engaging nature walk is easy, offering captivating insights. After the walk, return to the Glacier Guides and Montana Raft office in the early afternoon, benefiting from your knowledgeable guide's expertise. Typically, the tour concludes around 1:30 PM.

image.alt: Nature Walk in Glacier National Park

item.title: Glacier National Park Self-Guided Driving Audio Tour
item.description:
Experience the crown jewel of the national parks with this self-guided driving tour of Glacier, one of the most pristine and awe-inspiring landscapes on Earth. Cruise past crystal-clear glacial lakes, hike across breathtaking alpine tundras, and discover the secrets hidden in this sprawling wilderness. Plus, learn about the Blackfoot Confederacy, an ill-fated gold rush, and lots more along the way.
Recommended: Purchase one tour per car. Everyone can listen at the same time!
After booking, check your email to download the separate Audio Tour Guide App by Action, enter your unique password, and access your tour. These steps require good internet/Wi-Fi access. From there, follow the audio instructions and the route.
New, extra validity — now yours for an entire year! Use multiple times over multiple trips!
This isn't an entrance ticket. Check opening hours before your visit.

image.alt: Glacier National Park Self-Guided Driving Audio Tour

item.title: Winter Glacier National Park Scenic Driving Tour
item.description:
Private Winter Scenic Driving Tours focus on the western areas of Glacier National Park that are open in fall and winter. We make stops in and around Glacier National Park. Your guide will discuss the history of the park, glaciation, and other topics your private group is interested in.
Our stops include: the Hungry Horse Dam & Reservoir, Belton Bridge, Lake McDonald Lodge, Lake McDonald at Apgar Village and to round out the tour, ask your guide to stop at the Huckleberry Patch for a homemade milkshake or Glacier Park souvenir. We love our tours because they're custom, not combined with others and flexible to accommodate your group.

image.alt: Winter Glacier National Park Scenic Driving Tour

item.title: Pottery lesson Just For The Fun Of It.
item.description:
Steve will help you learn to experience the act of working with clay.
It can be a messy business but clay doesn't stain your clothes.
There are many parallels between making pottery and living a good life. Steve believes that learning to play with childlike abandon makes life and pottery all worthwhile.
During your pottery lesson, you will have the chance to use pottery making to not only begin the journey of learning a new skill, but you will also leave with new insight into how life works.
From the moment you enter the studio, it's obvious that you are here for a good time.
This will be a memorable experience that you can share with your parter.

image.alt: Pottery lesson Just For The Fun Of It.

item.title: Flathead Lake & Bison Range Scenic Driving Tour
item.description: Our Flathead Lake & Bison Range Tour is a fantastic way to explore a large section of Northwest Montana. Enjoy a narrated tour around Flathead Lake to the Bison Range and back. Wildlife viewing is definitely a highlight and we've had wonderful success during this tour. However, because we aren't able to predict animals movements, there is no guarantee of viewing, but great past experiences will boost your confidence. During this trip we make a stop into their Visitors Center, a lunch break, and, as long as there's enough time, we'll make other touristy pit stops you see along the way back.

image.alt: Flathead Lake & Bison Range Scenic Driving Tour

item.title: Snowshoe OR Cross Country Ski Tours in Glacier National Park
item.description: Spend half a day exploring Glacier National Park and the Flathead Valley with your own private guide on this half-day tour. Your guide will take you to Hungry Horse Reservoir, Lake McDonald, and the Agpar Visitor Center, sharing with you all sorts of historical information and anecdotes along the way.

image.alt: Snowshoe OR Cross Country Ski Tours in Glacier National Park

item.title: Driving Tour in Glacier National Park
item.description: Explore the captivating wonders of Glacier National Park on this tour, featuring must-visit destinations such as Apgar, West Glacier, the historic Belton Bridge, the serene Lake McDonald, and the iconic Lake McDonald Lodge. Delight in the beauty of Lion Dawn Shephard spring, and don't miss the opportunity to indulge in delicious huckleberry treats at the Huckleberry Patch store in Hungry Horse, Montana. This journey promises a perfect blend of natural beauty and delightful experiences. Leave behind snow prints and take cherished memories. This tour includes pass to Glacier National Park, lunch, and all transportation. Lunch choices include: Choice of sandwich: turkey, ham, roast beef, or veggie Choice of drink: coffee, tea, hot cocoa (water included for everyone) Other snack choices like chips, cookies, and crackers are provided.

image.alt: Driving Tour in Glacier National Park

item.title: Combo Tour: Driving and Snowshoe Trek of Glacier National Park
item.description:
Discover Glacier National Park at Your Pace! We customize all our tours for the experience level and comfort of our guests. Leave the driving to us and join our snowshoe and driving tour - Perfect for All! Let us show you the stunning highlights of Glacier National Park. Family-friendly and customized for your comfort and experience level. Leave behind snowprints and take cherished memories.
Lunch choices include: Choice of sandwich: turkey, ham, roast beef, or veggie Choice of drink: coffee, tea, hot cocoa (water included for everyone) Other snack choices like chips, cookies, and crackers are provided.

image.alt: Combo Tour: Driving and Snowshoe Trek of Glacier National Park

item.title: Self Guided Bike Tour in Glacier National Park
item.description: Explore Glacier's West Side by bike on this self-guided tour through West Glacier, Apgar and Fish Creek. This is the perfect trip for anyone looking for a day of exploring and adventure. Rent a bike from us and ride from our office, into West Glacier and around on Glacier's dedicated bike paths. Join in on a photo scavenger hunt and snap pictures of your day at locations from our interactive map. Ask our bike shop or front desk for a map when you rent your bike. Collect all photos and any additional while on your trip and receive a prize when you return your bike.

image.alt: Self Guided Bike Tour in Glacier National Park

item.title: Ultimate Audio Tours: Yellowstone, Glacier, Grand Teton & Banff
item.description:
Embark on a wondrous journey through Yellowstone, Grand Teton, Glacier National Park, and Banff, where Mother Nature's beauty is on full display. Gaze up at Grand Teton's majestic snow-capped peaks, witness Yellowstone's explosive geysers, experience Glacier's ancient ice formations, and visit Banff’s famous hot springs. This bundle of self-guided driving tours has it all!
We recommend purchasing one tour per car, allowing everyone to listen together!
After booking, check your email to download the separate Audio Tour Guide App by Action, enter your unique password, and access your tour. These steps require good internet/Wi-Fi access. From there, follow the audio instructions and the route.
New, extra validity — now yours for an entire year! Use multiple times over multiple trips!
This isn't an entrance ticket. Check opening hours before your visit.

image.alt: Ultimate Audio Tours: Yellowstone, Glacier, Grand Teton & Banff

item.title: Combo: Scenic Drive & 2hr Snowshoeing Tour in Glacier National Park
item.description: For those wishing an alternative take on Glacier National Park, this tour takes guests into West Glacier during winter when it's a winter wonderland. Take a tour of Hungry Horse Dam & Reservoir where you'll have a chance to get out and take your pictures. Then make your way to Lake McDonald lodge and Apgar village where your guide will pick a trail fit for the weather and your group to enjoy approximately an hour snowshoeing in the serene forest setting. Snowshoes, poles, light snacks and beverages included.

image.alt: Combo: Scenic Drive & 2hr Snowshoeing Tour in Glacier National Park

item.title: 30+ National Parks Self-Guided Driving Tours Bundle
item.description: Explore more than 20 national parks, monuments, and forests across the country, including the Grand Canyon, Joshua Tree, and Acadia, with this self-guided driving tour bundle. Enjoy the flexibility to travel at your own pace, with hands-free functionality, and offline access, so you can use it even in remote areas. Includes full itineraries, travel tips, audio guide, videos, and text.

image.alt: 30+ National Parks Self-Guided Driving Tours Bundle

item.title: Glacier National Park North Fork Audio Tour Guide
item.description:
Craving a wild escape? Glacier’s North Fork is your rugged retreat! Think serene lakes, epic mountain views, and more wildlife than you can count. Our audio tour guides you through Polebridge’s quirky charm, Bowman Lake’s peaceful shores, and the park’s untamed beauty. With stories of park history, ecology, and conservation, you’ll feel like an expert adventurer. Download, plug in, and explore Glacier’s remote wonderland—no crowds, just nature vibes!
*Download the Shaka Guide app to access the purchased tours*

image.alt: Glacier National Park North Fork Audio Tour Guide

item.title: Fun and Romantic Pottery Experience for Couples
item.description:
Steve will help you learn to experience the act of working with clay.
It can be a messy business but clay doesn't stain your clothes.
There are many parallels between making pottery and living a good life. Steve believes that learning to play with childlike abandon makes life and pottery all worthwhile.
During your pottery lesson, you will have the chance to use pottery making to not only begin the journey of learning a new skill, but you will also leave with new insight into how life works.
From the moment you enter the studio, it's obvious that you are here for a good time.
Dirrty Dates is for fun, not finishing a piece. You will leave feeling good and have a few photos. This will be a memorable experience that you can share with your parter.

image.alt: Fun and Romantic Pottery Experience for Couples
